name: AFD A101.6 Radio Compliance (MVP)
description: Scores fireground radio traffic for compliance with core A101.6 communication elements (size-up, command, CAN reports, accountability/safety, and key benchmark announcements). Uses transcript evidence; if not present in the audio, criteria should be marked not_observed rather than guessed.

sections.title: Arrival / Initial Radio Report (Size-Up)
sections.description: Evaluate first-arriving unitâ€™s initial size-up and arrival practices. Score only what is explicitly communicated.

criteria.title: Announces arrival / on scene
criteria.description: The first-arriving unit explicitly announces arrival/on scene.

criteria.title: Assumes command
criteria.description: The first-arriving officer assumes command (or clearly states who has command).

criteria.title: Declares tactical channel
criteria.description: Mentions the tactical channel / confirms operations are on the assigned tactical channel.

criteria.title: Describes structure / occupancy
criteria.description: Describes building (stories/occupancy/construction/roof) as part of size-up.

criteria.title: Describes fire/smoke conditions
criteria.description: Describes visible fire/smoke location/extent or conditions (e.g., Alpha/Bravo corner, attic, heavy smoke).

criteria.title: Declares strategy / mode of operation
criteria.description: Declares strategy (investigation/offensive/defensive) or mode of operation early.

criteria.title: Announces 360 (attempted/complete/not complete)
criteria.description: Announces intent to conduct a 360, or reports 360 complete/not complete with updates/corrections.

sections.title: Command Establishment & Transfer
sections.description: Evaluate clarity of command establishment, command post, and command transfer communications.

criteria.title: Command established promptly
criteria.description: Command is established promptly after first unit arrival (use transcript evidence; otherwise mark not_observed).
criteria.notes: Clock starts at first unit arrival. If the radio traffic does not include explicit arrival and command timing, mark not_observed.

criteria.title: Command post location announced
criteria.description: Command post location is announced and identifiable (e.g., 'command post on the west side behind...').

criteria.title: Alpha side designation confirmed
criteria.description: Alpha side is designated/confirmed when relevant.

criteria.title: Command transfer is structured
criteria.description: When command is transferred, the transfer includes assignment/status context (e.g., strategy confirmation, divisions/groups, key hazards).

sections.title: CAN Reports (Conditions / Actions / Needs)
sections.description: Evaluate whether CAN reports are used and complete enough to support incident coordination.

criteria.title: CAN reports issued
criteria.description: One or more CAN-style updates are transmitted (explicit CAN or equivalent structure).

criteria.title: CAN: conditions communicated
criteria.description: CAN reports include conditions (location/heat/fire/smoke/visibility).

criteria.title: CAN: actions communicated
criteria.description: CAN reports include actions being performed (e.g., advancing line, searching, ventilation).

criteria.title: CAN: needs communicated
criteria.description: CAN reports include needs (resources required) or explicitly state no needs.

sections.title: Benchmark Announcements
sections.description: Evaluate whether key benchmark events are announced over the radio (as heard in the transcript).

criteria.title: Primary search complete announced
criteria.description: Primary search completion is announced (including victim status if mentioned).

criteria.title: Secondary search complete announced
criteria.description: Secondary search completion is announced (including victim status if mentioned).

criteria.title: Fire knocked down announced
criteria.description: Fire knocked down (including blitz if applicable) is announced.

criteria.title: Fire under control announced
criteria.description: Fire under control is announced.

criteria.title: Fire extinguished announced
criteria.description: Fire extinguished is announced.

criteria.title: Utilities shutoff announced
criteria.description: Utility shutoff (power/gas) is announced if applicable.

sections.title: Safety & Accountability Messaging
sections.description: Evaluate presence/clarity of safety-critical radio messaging (RIC, safety officer, MAYDAY readiness if present).

criteria.title: RIC established/announced
criteria.description: RIC team is assigned/announced with unit identification (as heard in transcript).

criteria.title: Safety officer assigned/announced
criteria.description: Safety officer role is assigned/announced (as heard in transcript).

criteria.title: MAYDAY handled correctly (if it occurs)
criteria.description: If a MAYDAY occurs in the audio, the radio traffic shows clear MAYDAY declaration and disciplined command response. If no MAYDAY occurs, mark not_applicable.
criteria.notes: This criterion is conditional: if no MAYDAY is present, it should be scored as not_applicable with no penalty.
